section.name: Parsing an RSS feed
section.p: To read in an RSS feed you have to provide basically two things: a source from where to read the feed (URL, File, InputStream or Reader) and a ChannelBuilder which builds the news channel object model. Currently two ChannelBuilder are available: one in-memory (see de.nava.informa.impl.basic.ChannelBuilder) and the other one using the Hibernate O/R mapping mechansim to persist the data in a relational database (see de.nava.informa.impl.hibernate.ChannelBuilder). section.name: Hibernate configuration
section.p:
The Hibernate 2 library files are provided with the informa distribution. If you do not want to use the Hypersonic SQL database, you have to make sure that you include any files required for JDBC connectivity to the database in the classpath.
The first file that to investigate is the hibernate.properties file. Place this file in your classpath so that Hibernate can find it at runtime. This file contains the runtime settings that Hibernate will use when it is started up. Here is an example:
There are also DDLs (for MySQL, PostgreSQL and HSQL) for the tables needed by Informa's hibernate backend provided with the distribution under the directory sql.
